abstract: The Rio Tinto Group, a mining company that is a major producer of coal, will join BP to develop power generation plants that will pump their carbon dioxide emissions underground to help curb global warming. The companies said Thursday that Rio would pay BP $32 million for a 50 percent stake in a new company, to be called Hydrogen Energy. BP will fold its carbon capture and storage operations into the new entity.
lead_paragraph: The Rio Tinto Group, a mining company that is a major producer of coal, will join BP to develop power generation plants that will pump their carbon dioxide emissions underground to help curb global warming. The companies said Thursday that Rio would pay BP $32 million for a 50 percent stake in a new company, to be called Hydrogen Energy. BP will fold its carbon capture and storage operations into the new entity.

headline.main: BP and Rio Tinto Team Up for Venture
